      • sortBubble

        public static void sortBubble(int[] tab)
        Sort the table according to the bubble way : - Compare two first elements of the table. Permut their value if one is greater than the other - Do the same for the following elements - At the end, the maximum is at the last index of the table - Repeat the operations but on the size (length-1), then (length-2) and so on
        Parameters:
        tab - The table to do the sorting

      • SortMin

        public static int[] SortMin(int[] tab)
        Sort the table according to the minimum way : - Create a new table with the same size as the input - Define the max of the input - Define the min of the input. Save this value in the new table - In the input, put the (max+1) at the index where the min was found - Repeat the operations
        Parameters:
        tab - The table to sort
        Returns:
        A new sorted table

      • factorial

        public static int factorial(int n)
        Calculate the factorial of a number
        Parameters:
        n - The number to calculate
        Returns:
        The factorial of the number

      • sumRecursive

        public static int sumRecursive(int[] tab)
        Do the recursive sum : - For each index of the table - do the sum from (index+1) to (length-1) - add the result to the tag[index] - save this value - repeat - Do the sum of the saved values and return it
        Parameters:
        tab - The table
        Returns:
        The recursive sum
